sentences.sContent: The morning paper carried a story about demonstrations in New York and Washington D.C.
sentences.sCn: 晨报登载了纽约和华盛顿特区举行示威游行的报道。

sentences.sContent: The national TV network carries religious programmes.
sentences.sCn: 全国电视网播出宗教节目。

sentences.sContent: ...and balance these great innovations with the potential downsides they naturally carry with them...
...But it is another thing to have a supply of trained talent that could let you carry out this promise...
...They typically carry financial burdens that outweigh those of their peers...
...had recently suggested that a SpaceShipTwo craft would carry its first paying customers as soon as February 2015...
...Getting enough to eat and enjoying the safety and comfort of living fully on the grid is certainly a good thing — but it does carry an environmental price...

...This ability seems to carry with it certain cultural assumptions — that everything that can be measured should be measured; that data is a transparent and reliable lens that allows us to filter out emotionalism and ideology; that data will help us do remarkable things — like foretell the future...
...They want to know if the economic crisis would affect our ability to carry out the deal we signed lastNovember...
...many Hamilton students grow passionate about the weighty volumes they still carry from dorm room to lecture hall to library...

trans.tranOther: if a newspaper, a television or radio broadcast, or a website carries a piece of news, an advertisement etc, it prints it or broadcasts it
